content:
Diagnosis:		Pancreatic adenocarcinoma

Management:		12 Jan 2024 Whipple's procedure

Histology:		Moderately differentiated pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma
		pT3N1M0 (AJCC 8th Ed, Stage IIB)
		BRAF V600E mutation positive

Current situation:	Post-operative follow-up

[redacted name] attended clinic today for routine follow-up following completion of adjuvant modified FOLFIRINOX chemotherapy in May 2024. She has made an excellent recovery from her surgery and subsequent chemotherapy. Her post-treatment CT scan on 15/6/24 shows no evidence of disease recurrence. Her CA19-9 has normalized at 12 U/mL. Her weight has stabilized at 68kg and appetite continues to improve. She reports mild peripheral neuropathy affecting her fingertips only, which is gradually improving. Her pancreatic enzyme replacement is well-optimized with no symptoms of malabsorption. The plan is for ongoing 3-monthly surveillance with next CT scan and CA19-9 due in September 2024. She will be reviewed in clinic following these investigations.

cancer_timeline.value: CT scan shows no evidence of disease recurrence

patient_facts.value: mild peripheral neuropathy affecting fingertips only, gradually improving
weight stabilized at 68kg with improving appetite

status_updates.value: Stage IIB pancreatic adenocarcinoma status post Whipple's procedure and adjuvant chemotherapy. Currently no evidence of disease recurrence.
mild peripheral neuropathy affecting fingertips only, gradually improving
CT scan and CA19-9 due September 2024
clinic review following investigations in September 2024
